question.title: Unable to deploy jar on liberty 3.7.1 despite successful build; RC=24
question.body:
I'm trying to compile my websphere project in open liberty. Maven clean+build comes up clean and compiles with no errors. But when I try to run liberty:run, I'm getting the following:

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal io.openliberty.tools:liberty-maven-plugin:3.7.1:run (default-cli) on project ACONEAR: CWWKM2002E: Failed to invoke ["C:\git\repos\eclipse\acon\ACONEAR\target\liberty\wlp\bin\server.bat", run, defaultServer]. RC= 24 but expected=0. -> [Help 1]

org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal io.openliberty.tools:liberty-maven-plugin:3.7.1:run (default-cli) on project ACONEAR: CWWKM2002E: Failed to invoke ["C:\git\repos\eclipse\acon\ACONEAR\target\liberty\wlp\bin\server.bat", run, defaultServer]. RC= 24 but expected=0.

at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute(MojoExecutor.java:215)

at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute(MojoExecutor.java:156)

at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute(MojoExecutor.java:148)

at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.LifecycleModuleBuilder.buildProject(LifecycleModuleBuilder.java:117)

at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.LifecycleModuleBuilder.buildProject(LifecycleModuleBuilder.java:81)

at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.builder.singlethreaded.SingleThreadedBuilder.build(SingleThreadedBuilder.java:56)

at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.LifecycleStarter.execute(LifecycleStarter.java:128)

at org.apache.maven.DefaultMaven.doExecute(DefaultMaven.java:305)

at org.apache.maven.DefaultMaven.doExecute(DefaultMaven.java:192)

at org.apache.maven.DefaultMaven.execute(DefaultMaven.java:105)

at org.apache.maven.cli.MavenCli.execute(MavenCli.java:957)

at org.apache.maven.cli.MavenCli.doMain(MavenCli.java:289)

at org.apache.maven.cli.MavenCli.main(MavenCli.java:193)

at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:90)

at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:55)

at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:508)

at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.launchEnhanced(Launcher.java:282)

at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.launch(Launcher.java:225)

at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.mainWithExitCode(Launcher.java:406)

at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:347)

Caused by: org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException: CWWKM2002E: Failed to invoke ["C:\git\repos\eclipse\acon\ACONEAR\target\liberty\wlp\bin\server.bat", run, defaultServer]. RC= 24 but expected=0.

at org.codehaus.mojo.pluginsupport.MojoSupport.execute(MojoSupport.java:137)

at org.apache.maven.plugin.DefaultBuildPluginManager.executeMojo(DefaultBuildPluginManager.java:137)

at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute(MojoExecutor.java:210)

... 20 more

Caused by: CWWKM2002E: Failed to invoke ["C:\git\repos\eclipse\acon\ACONEAR\target\liberty\wlp\bin\server.bat", run, defaultServer]. RC= 24 but expected=0.

at io.openliberty.tools.ant.ServerTask.doRun(ServerTask.java:376)

at io.openliberty.tools.ant.ServerTask.execute(ServerTask.java:145)

at io.openliberty.tools.maven.server.RunServerMojo.doExecute(RunServerMojo.java:131)

at org.codehaus.mojo.pluginsupport.MojoSupport.execute(MojoSupport.java:122)

... 22 more

[ERROR] 

[ERROR] 

[ERROR] For more information about the errors and possible solutions, please read the following articles:

[ERROR] [Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/MojoExecutionException

[ERROR] 

[ERROR] After correcting the problems, you can resume the build with the command

[ERROR]   mvn <args> -rf :ACONEAR

Anyone have any experience with decoding these errors or getting open liberty to run? I did check the ffdc logs, and this is the only error that comes up:

Exception = java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError
Source = com.ibm.ws.kernel.launch.internal.ProvisionerImpl
probeid = 337
Stack Dump = java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java.nio.file.FileSystems$DefaultFileSystemHolder (initialization failure)

at com.ibm.ws.kernel.boot.cmdline.EnvCheck.main(EnvCheck.java:37)
Caused by: java.lang.AssertionError: Default directory is not an absolute path
at sun.nio.fs.WindowsFileSystem.<init>(WindowsFileSystem.java:73)
at sun.nio.fs.WindowsFileSystemProvider.<init>(WindowsFileSystemProvider.java:65)
at sun.nio.fs.DefaultFileSystemProvider.create(DefaultFileSystemProvider.java:48)
at java.nio.file.FileSystems$DefaultFileSystemHolder.getDefaultProvider(FileSystems.java:119)
at java.nio.file.FileSystems$DefaultFileSystemHolder.access$000(FileSystems.java:100)

at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(AccessController.java:678)
at java.nio.file.FileSystems$DefaultFileSystemHolder.defaultFileSystem(FileSystems.java:107)
at java.nio.file.FileSystems$DefaultFileSystemHolder.<clinit>(FileSystems.java:101)
... 18 more

Messages.log shows this:

[6/4/25 10:33:08:556 EDT] 00000001 com.ibm.ws.logging.internal.impl.IncidentImpl                I FFDC1015I: An FFDC Incident has been created: "java.lang.AssertionError: Default directory is not an absolute path com.ibm.ws.kernel.launch.internal.ProvisionerImpl 337" at ffdc_25.06.04 10.33.08.0.log
[6/4/25 10:33:08:599 EDT] 00000001 com.ibm.ws.logging.internal.impl.IncidentImpl                I FFDC1015I: An FFDC Incident has been created: "java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java.nio.file.FileSystems$DefaultFileSystemHolder (initialization failure) com.ibm.ws.kernel.launch.internal.ProvisionerImpl 337" at ffdc_25.06.04_10.33.08.1.log
[6/4/25 10:33:08:620 EDT] 00000001 com.ibm.ws.logging.internal.impl.IncidentImpl                I FFDC1015I: An FFDC Incident has been created: "java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java.nio.file.FileSystems$DefaultFileSystemHolder (initialization failure) com.ibm.ws.kernel.launch.internal.ProvisionerImpl checkInstallStatus" at ffdc_25.06.04_10.33.08.2.log
[6/4/25 10:33:08:630 EDT] 00000001 com.ibm.ws.logging.internal.impl.IncidentImpl                I FFDC1015I: An FFDC Incident has been created: "java.lang.AssertionError: Default directory is not an absolute path com.ibm.ws.kernel.launch.internal.ProvisionerImpl checkInstallStatus" at ffdc_25.06.04_10.33.08.3.log

I'm not sure what to do with that.

question_comments.body: It is expected that before asking a question you tried to research the issue, including searching for similar errors.

Failed to invoke ["C:\git\repos\eclipse\acon\ACONEAR\target\liberty\wlp\bin\s‌​erver.bat" the error seems to indicate that it is trying to execute a Windows batch file and that fails for some reason. I would start checking if that path is correct. Also the other error mentions a path error but with no details: java.lang.AssertionError: Default directory is not an absolute path. Since there is no more information I suspect that is as much as people here can help. You should search for similar errors, for example: stackoverflow.com/questions/53774782/…
@aled which path are you referring to? The FFDC stack mentions a path, but I'm not sure what additional paths I need to define. I have JAVA_HOME defined, so not sure what else it needs.
@Alasdair I just updated my question with the two stack traces. Not super helpful from maven.
Can you paste the full exception with the full stack?
Is the path mentioned in the error the correct one? If you need more help with this then I suggest to read How to Ask and provide a minimal reproducible example.
